vulnerabilities.title: Idor in SecureApp Inc
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Insecure Direct Object Reference on API affecting SecureApp Inc. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to access or modify resources belonging to other users.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: See steps

This demonstrates Insecure Direct Object Reference on API

# Validation at 2025-11-06T11:24:36.103352
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-06T11:24:36.103350
vulnerabilities.remediation: Implement proper authorization checks for all object access. Use indirect references or verify ownership before allowing access to resources.

vulnerabilities.title: Ssrf in SecureApp Inc
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params affecting SecureApp Inc. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to make requests to internal systems and potentially access sensitive data.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: http://localhost

This demonstrates Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params

# Validation at 2025-11-06T11:24:36.103354
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-06T11:24:36.103353
vulnerabilities.remediation: Validate and sanitize all URLs. Implement allowlist of permitted domains. Use network segmentation to limit internal access.
